sections.sectionDescription: Admission Details, Orientation to Facility and Preferences

questions.questionText: MD contacted and order obtained for code status per above resident/resident representative request?

Resident and/or responsible party oriented to room, bathroom, smoking rules, nursing unit, bath schedules, meal times and verbalizes/demonstrates use of call light, bed controls, TV, and telephone if applicable/able.
Does the resident have valuables on site?
Recommended valuables to be taken out of facility?
List of valuables remaining in the facility.

responseOptions.responseText: Medications and orders were verified with provider.

questions.questionText: Upon review of the admission medications, were any potential issues identified?
Was the physician or designee contacted about the medication issue?
Date and time physician was contacted.
Did the physician prescribe or recommend any actions in response to the medication issue?
Is the resident receiving any of the following medication classes or types?

Educated resident and/or responsible party on anticoagulant medication used to treatment prevention of blood clots and certain cardiac conditions. Risks include increased potential for abnormal bleeding, bruising, etc and to Notify your nurse if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

Used to treat infection. Educated resident and/or responsible party on risks include allergic reactions such as itching, hives, rashes, difficulty swallowing or breathing. Notify your nurse immediately if you experience any of these symptoms.
Educated resident and/or responsible party on s/sx of hyper and hypoglycemia and low blood sugar, notify your nurse immediately if you experience any of these symptoms.
Does the resident choose to self-administer medications?
Can the resident read label and/or correctly identify each medication?
Can the resident correctly state what each medication is used for?
Can the resident correctly state what time each medication is to be taken?
Can the resident correctly state the correct medication dosage?
Can the resident demonstrate ability to open medication containers?
Can the resident correctly measure the appropriate amount of medications from container?
Can the resident correctly document self-administration of the medication?
Can the resident demonstrate secure storage of medication(s) kept in room?
Can the resident correctly state situations warranting administration of PRN medications?
Can the resident correctly self-administer subcutaneous injections?
Can the resident correctly self-administer inhalant medications according to proper procedure?
Can the resident correctly self-administer eye drops or eye ointments?
Can the resident correctly apply topical ointments, creams, or transdermal patches according to MD orders?
Can the resident self-administer ear drops correctly?
Can the resident self-administer rectal suppositories according to proper procedure?
Can the resident self-administer vaginal suppositories according to proper procedure?
Can the resident correctly identify the time for refilling prescriptions?

responseOptions.responseText: UNABLEScore is greater than or equal to 8 and/or improper/unsafe technique is used, the resident is deemed UNABLE to safely administer medications.
ABLEScore is 0-7 and IDT finds resident demonstrates appropriate administration techniques, resident is ABLE to safely administer medications.
Specialty therapeutic or mechanically altered diet

questions.questionText: If answer to question 1 is "assistive devices", describe:
Type of non-oral nutritional support being provided:
Does the resident wear a dental appliance (i.e., dentures, partial, etc.)?
Does the resident have the appliance with him/her at facility?

responseOptions.responseText: Mouth or facial pain, discomfort, or difficulty with chewing
Abnormal mouth tissue (ulcers, masses, lesions,including under denture or partial if one is worn)
No natural teeth or tooth fragments
Obvious or likely cavity or broken natural teeth

questions.questionText: Does the resident have any of the following symptoms/diagnoses? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Predisposing conditions (vomiting, diarrhea, fever, infection, diabetes)
Function impairment that makes it difficult to drink, reach fluids, or communicate fluid needs (aphasia)
Dementia in which resident forgets how to eat or drink
Alternative nutritional intake (NPO, parenteral, enteral, thickened liquids)

questions.questionText: Does the resident present with any of the following neurological signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Cognitive status change from baseline in level of consciousness, recalle, memory, or decision-making ability
Flaccidity, muscle rigidity, tremors, paralysis, or paresthesia
Fatigue related to extremity weakness, spasticity, and stressors
Change in balance or gait pattern
Irrational thoughts (i.e.,I need to pick up my children at school")
Other behavioral symptoms (i.e., hitting or scratching self, pacing, rummaging, disruptive sounds, public disrobing, etc.)
Past history of elopement or exit seeking
Rejection of care that is necessary for health and well-being (i.e., taking medications, bloodwork, treatments, etc.)
Physical symptoms toward others (i.e., hitting, kicking, pushing, scratching, grabbing, etc.)
Repeated failures to respond to redirection
Verbal symptoms toward others (i.e., threatening, screaming, cursing, etc.)

questions.questionText: Does the resident have any skin abnormalities?
Select location(s) of skin abnormality(ies). Document a description of each skin abnormality.
Does the resident require staff assistance with and of the following ADL's (select all that apply):
Does the resident require a mechanical lift of device for transfers?
Does the resident require an enabling and/or safety device? (i.e. assist rail, bed alarm, Broda chair etc.):
Select alternative immediate enabling and/or safety interventions in place.

responseOptions.responseText: Visual and/or verbal reminders to use call light

questions.questionText: Safety intervention or device care plan
Does the resident present with any of the following cardiovascular signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Abnormal heart sounds or rhythm on auscultation
Chest, neck, jaw or arm pain
Cramping or pain in the lower extremities
Cool, moist, pale and/or mottled skin

questions.questionText: Does the resident present with any of the following respiratory signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Dyspnea at rest or during activity
Cyanosis of lips, fingers, feet or nailbeds
Chest pain or pain on inspiration or expiration
Sternal retraction or unequal chest expansion

questions.questionText: Document findings of lung sound evaluation
Quality of respirations (Select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: Unable to lay flat due to shortness of breath

questions.questionText: <b>Is the head of the bed elevated to prevent SOB while lying flat?<b>
Does the resident have a tracheostomy?
Does the resident present with any of the following gastrointestinal signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply)

responseOptions.responseText: Abdomnial pain, distention, epigastric distress or tenderness
Recent significant weight loss or gain

questions.questionText: Document findings of bowel sounds evaluation and observation
Does the resident have an ostomy?
Does the resident present with any of the following genitourinary signs/symptoms? (Select all that apply)

responseOptions.responseText: Urinary frequency, hesitancy, dysuria, or urgency

questions.questionText: Does the resident have a urinary catheter?
What type of catheter is being used?
What size catheter and balloon is in place?
What type of dialysis is the resident receiving?
Does the resident present with any of the following signs/symptoms? Select all that apply).

responseOptions.responseText: Nausea/vomiting, bad breath, ammonia smell or GI upset
Pale, excessively dry or itchy skin
Swelling of the feet, face or eyes

questions.questionText: Document packs per day and length of time. If quit, how long ago?
If the resident currently smokes, answer questions below.
Able to make decisions regarding tasks of daily life.
The resident communicates effectively with others.
Demonstrates ability to light and smoke a cigarette or other smoking device.
Demonstrates safe technique for putting out matches or lighter and disposing of ash.
Demonstrates ability to physically hold the smoking device while smoking.
Demonstrates ability to verbalize understanding that smoking materials are for use only in designated smoking areas.
The resident is determined to be:
The following are recommendations for the resident while smoking (select all that apply)
Smoking policy given to resident/responsible party?
Is the resident currently receiving an antipsychotic medication or other type that requires AIMS monitoring (i.e, Reglan)?
Muscles of Facial Expression (e.g., movements of forehead, eyebrows, periorbital area, cheeks; including frowning, grimacing,blinking, smiling)
Lips and perioral area (i.e., puckering, pouting, smacking):
Jaw (i.e., biting, clenching, chewing, mouth opening, lateral movement):
Tongue (Rate only increases in movement both in and out of mouth NOT inability to sustain movement):

Upper Extremities (arms, wrists, hands, and fingers). Include choreic movements [i.e., rapid, objectively purposeless, irregular, spontaneous], athetoid [i.e., slow, irregular, complex, serpentine]. DO NOT include tremors [i.e., repetitive, regular, rhythmic].
Lower Extremities (legs, knees, ankles, toes). Observe for lateral knee movement, foot tapping, heel dropping, foot squirming, inversion and eversion of foot.
Neck, Shoulders and Hips (i.e., rocking, twisting, squirming, pelvic gyrations):
Awareness of abnormal movements (Rate only what the resident reports).
Current problem with teeth and/or dentures?
Ask resident: "Have you had pain or hurting at any time in the last 5 days?"

questions.questionTitle: How much of the time have you experienced pain or hurting over the last 5 days?
Over the past 5 days, how much of the time has pain made it hard for you to sleep at night?
Over the past 5 days, how often have you limited your participation in rehabilitation therapy sessions due to pain?

responseOptions.responseText: Does not apply - I have not received rehabilitation therapy in the past 5 days

questions.questionTitle: Over the past 5 days, how often have you limited your day-to-day activities (excluding rehabilitation therapy sessions) because of pain?

questions.questionText: If pain is present, date of onset if known:

questions.questionTitle: Numeric Pain Scale:  Please rate your worst pain over the last 5 days on a zero to ten scale, with zero being no pain and ten as the worst pain you can imagine. (Show resident 00-10 pain scale)
Verbal Descriptor Scale:  Please rate the intensity of your worst pain over the last 5 days. (Show resident verbal scale)

questions.questionText: Non-verbal indicators of pain (select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: Negative vocalizations (i.e., moaning, groaning, crying, calling out)
Body language (i.e., tensed, distressed, pacing, fists clenched, striking out, knees pulled up, guarding)

questions.questionText: Location of pain and description from resident, if able:
Pain is relieved by (check all that apply):
Is the resident satisfied with pain control?
Ability to respond meaningfully to pressure-related discomfort:

responseOptions.responseText: Completely limited:Unresponsive (does not moan, flinch, or grasp) to painful stimuli due to diminished level of consciousness or sedation OR limited ability to feel pain over most of body surfaces.

Very Limited: Responds only to painful stimuli, cannot communicate discomfort except by moaning or restlessness OR has a sensory impairment which limits the ability to feel pain or discomfort over 1/2 of body.

Slightly Limited: Responds to verbal commands, but cannot always communicate discomfort or need to be turned OR Has some sensory impairment which limits ability to feel pain or discomfort in 1 or 2 extremities.
No Impairment: Responds to verbal commands. Has no sensory deficit which would limit ability to feel or voice pain or discomfort.

questions.questionText: Degree to which skin is exposed to moisture:

responseOptions.responseText: Constantly Moist: Skin is kept moist almost constantly by perspiration, urine, etc. Dampness is detected every time patient is moved or turned.
Very Moist: Skin is often, but not always moist. Linen must be changed at least once a shift.
Occasionally Moist: Skin is occasionally moist, requiring an extra linen change approximately once a day.
Rarely Moist: Skin is usually dry, linen only requires changing at routine intervals.
Chairfast: Ability to walk is severely limited or nonexistent. cannot bear own weight and/or must be assisted into chair or wheelchair
Walks Occasionally: Walks occasionally during day, but for very short distances with or without assistance. Spends majority of each shift in bed or chair
Walks Frequently: Walks outside the room at least twice a day and inside room at least every 2 hours during waking hours

questions.questionText: Ability to change and control body position:

responseOptions.responseText: Completely Immobile: Does not make even slight changes in body or extremity position without assistance
Very Limited: Makes occasional slight changes in body or extremity position but unable to make frequent or significant changes independently
Slightly Limited: Makes frequent though slight changes in body or extremity position independently
No Limitations: Makes major and frequent changes in position without assistance

Very Poor: Never eats a complete meal. Rarely eats more than 1/3 of any food offered. Eats 2 servings or less of protein (meat or dairy products) per day. Takes fluids poorly. Does not take a liquid dietary supplement OR is NPO and/or maintained on clear liquids or IV

Probably Inadequate: Rarely eats a complete meal and generally eats only about 1/2 of any food offered. Protein intake includes only 3 servings of meat or dairy products per day. Occasionally will take a dietary supplement OR receives less than optimum amount of liquid diet or tube feeding.

Adequate: Eats over half of most meals. Eats a total of 4 servings of protein (meat, dairy products) per day. Occasionally will refuse a meal, but will usually take a supplement when offered OR is on a tube feeding or TPN regimen which probably meets most of nutritional needs.
Excellent: Eats most of every meal. Never refuses a meal. Usually eats a total of 4 or more servings of meat and dairy products. Occasionally eats between meals. Does not require supplementation.

Problem: Requires moderate to maximum assistance in moving. Complete lifting without sliding against sheets is impossible. Frequently slides down in bed or chair, requiring frequent repositioning with maximum assistance. Spasticity, contractures, or agitation leads to almost constant friction

Potential Problem: Moves freely or requires minimum assistance. During a move, skin, probably slides to some extent againste sheets, chair, restraints, or other devices. Maintains relatively good position in chair or bed most of the time but occasionally slides down
No Apparent Problem: Moves in bed and in chair independently and has sufficient muscle strength to lift up completely during move. Maintains good position in bed or chair at all times
Alert and oriented x3 OR Comatose
Alert and oriented X2 OR Lethargic
Alert and oriented x1 OR Periodic confusion
Does NOT wander, has NEVER eloped
Has history of elopement with NO exit seeking behaviors in the last 90 days
Resident family/representative voice concern the resident may try to leave facility
Has history of elopement OR Wanders with history of exit seeking
Totally or mostly dependent in locomotion
Ambulates independently with walker or cane
Discontent, but agreeable to facility placement
Discontent, and disagrees with facility placement

questions.questionTitle: Risk Score: Add the points from the 4 categories above and immediately implement the intervention indicated by the corresponding score.

responseOptions.responseText: Score of 0-9. NOT AT RISK for elopement. No interventions at this time
Score of of 10-14. AT RISK for elopement. Place picture in elopement book. Apply wanderguard, (if facility has system available).
Score of 15 or above. HIGH RISK for elopement. Place picture in elopement book. Apply wanderguard, (if facility has system available). Notify the DON for interdisciplinary review.

questions.questionText: Has the resident fallen during the present admission or an immediate history of falls prior to admission?
Does the resident have more than one medical diagnosis?
Does the resident use aid for ambulation?
Does the resident currently have an IV or IV access site?
Which best describes the resident's gait?
Does the resident know their own ability related to ambulation?
Was the resident admitted with an active infection requiring antibiotic therapy?
Is the resident on isolation precautions?
What type of isolation precautions are in place?
Please check one of the following side rail types:
Is resident immobile? (If Yes, do not proceed any further).
Is resident totally dependent on staff for turning and repositoning?
Is resident unaware of safety and physical deficiencies?
Does the resident have impaired trunk control or impaired sitting balance?
Does the resident have a history of falls?
Does the resident have an increased potential for falls?
Is the resident currently using the siderails to faciliate transfer, bed mobility, or positioning?
Is the resident able to use the call light as desired?
Siderails are indicated and serve as an enabler to facilitate transfer, bed mobility, and/or positioning.
Resident has requested to have siderails raised.
Medical diagnosis warrants the use of side rails.
Resident is totally dependent on staff. SIDE RAILS NOT CONSIDERED A RESTRAINT.
Siderails are needed, based on resident's status and the above documentation.
Document summary of IDT review and discussion related to the resident's need/desire for side rails.
Does the resident have a vascular access device in place?
What type of device is present?
Description of Site (Select all that apply):
If appropriate, resident/responsible party education and teach-back provided. (Select all that apply):

responseOptions.responseText: Education was provided to the resident/responsible party regarding hand hygiene, cough etiquette, social distancing, and reporting signs and symptoms such as new cough, sore throat, fever, shortness of breath, or diarrhea to the nurse

questions.questionText: I have reviewed and approved this evaluation for accuracy and completion.
